intro: Freziera yungasia, commonly known as the Yungas freziera, is a flowering plant native to the Yungas region of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
